meanings.definition: Honor or praise awarded for achievement.
meanings.sent1: She received many laurels for her hard work in school.
meanings.sent2: The actor basked in the glory of his laurels after winning the award.
meanings.sent3: The cat proudly wore a laurel crown made of paper as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The team's victory in the championship game was the crowning laurels of their season.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind words were the sweetest laurels the student had ever received.

meanings.definition: Wreaths of laurel leaves worn as a symbol of victory or honor.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, warriors would wear laurels to show their bravery.
meanings.sent2: The statue of the goddess was adorned with laurels around her head.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the laurels from the garden and wore them as a necklace.
meanings.sent4: The bride felt like she was wearing laurels on her wedding day with all the compliments she received.
meanings.sent5: The champion's head was crowned with laurels, signifying his triumph in the competition.
